publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1296 Alasdair Morgan: The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal—That the Parliament notes the tragic death of Brenda-Jane Armstrong of Twynholm, Kirkcudbrightshire, who was stillborn at Cresswell Maternity Hospital, Dumfries on 14 September 2000; further notes that in rural Scotland expectant mothers often have to travel considerable distances to get quality ultra-sound scans, and gives its full backing to the appeal fund, "The Brenda Jane Fund", set up in her memory by her parents Brendan Armstrong and Jane McSkirmming, to raise the £15,000 required to purchase a portable ultrasound scanner for use in rural Kirkcudbrightshire.
S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) Mr Alex Salmond*, Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) David Mundell*, Tommy Sheridan*, Christine Grahame*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) Mr Murray Tosh*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-1296 Alasdair Morgan: The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal—That the Parliament notes the tragic death of Brenda-Jane Armstrong of Twynholm, Kirkcudbrightshire, who was stillborn at Cresswell Maternity Hospital, Dumfries on 14 September 2000; further notes that in rural Scotland expectant mothers often have to travel considerable distances to get quality ultra-sound scans, and gives its full backing to the appeal fund, "The Brenda Jane Fund", set up in her memory by her parents Brendan Armstrong and Jane McSkirmming, to raise the £15,000 required to purchase a portable ultrasound scanner for use in rural Kirkcudbrightshire. Supported by: Mr Alex Salmond, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, David Mundell, Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Fiona McLeod, Mr Murray Tosh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Dr Elaine Murray, Alex Fergusson*
S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) Michael Russell*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Irene McGugan*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr David Davidson*
S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) Ms Sandra White*

Supported by: Mr Alex Salmond, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, David Mundell, Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Fiona McLeod, Mr Murray Tosh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Dr Elaine Murray, Alex Fergusson, Michael Russell, Donald Gorrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Irene McGugan, Tricia Marwick, Mr David Davidson, Ms Sandra White

S1M-1296 The Brenda Jane Fund - portable ultra-sound scanner appeal (lodged on 30 October 2000) Kay Ullrich*
